Title.evidence: CHAMP: A Randomised Controlled Trial of Mesenchymal Stromal Cells in Critical Limb Ischemia

Trial_Design.evidence: randomised to receive intramuscular injections of allogeneic MSCs (n=16) or autogenous concentrated bone marrow aspirate (cBMA, n=16)

Participants.evidence: The study setting included [study location], with eligibility criteria encompassing patients with rest pain or tissue loss.

Intervention.evidence: randomised to receive intramuscular injections of allogeneic MSCs (n=16) or autogenous concentrated bone marrow aspirate (cBMA, n=16)

Objective.evidence: This study aims to assess the safety and therapeutic mechanisms of mesenchymal stromal cells (MSC) in patients with CLI requiring below-knee amputation (BKA).

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was proangiogenic cytokine expression, assessed at the time of amputation.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation was computer-generated, with allocation concealment achieved through sealed envelopes.

Blinding.evidence: Blinding was applied to outcome assessors.

Number_Randomised.evidence: The phase I/II CHAMP trial enrolled 32 extremities with CLI requiring BKA

Number_Analysed.evidence: To date, ten patients have been treated per protocol.

Result_Outcome.evidence: Preliminary findings suggest potential efficacy in enhancing proangiogenic cytokine expression.

Harms.evidence: Adverse events were monitored, with no severe events reported thus far.
